Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been good, thanks! I started planning my trip to Italy.
That’s exciting! How has the planning process been for you?
It’s been fun but a bit overwhelming. I’m trying to keep everything organized.
It’s understandable to feel that way. What have you done so far?
I booked my flights and found a couple of potential Airbnb places.
That’s a great start! How did you feel when you accomplished those tasks?
I felt relieved, but I still have a lot to figure out, like the itinerary.
It sounds like you’re making progress! Have you thought about what you want to see while you’re there?
Yes! I want to see the Colosseum, visit some art museums, and just explore the streets.
Those are wonderful choices! Exploring the streets can lead to some of the best experiences. How do you feel about the itinerary planning?
A bit anxious, honestly. I want to make the most of my time but don’t want to over-schedule myself.
That’s a good insight. Finding that balance is key. Would you like to brainstorm a flexible itinerary that allows for exploration without feeling rushed?
Yes, I would appreciate that!
Great! Let’s start with your must-see places. How many days do you plan to spend in Italy?
Around ten days.
Perfect! That gives you ample time to explore. What’s your first must-see location?
The Colosseum for sure.
Excellent choice! You might want to consider booking a guided tour to get the most out of the experience.
That’s a good idea. I hadn’t thought of that.
After the Colosseum, what’s next on your list?
I think I’d like to visit the Vatican Museums.
That’s an iconic spot as well. You could plan those two visits on the same day since they’re close to each other.
That makes sense.
What about some downtime? It’s important to allow yourself time to relax and soak in the atmosphere.
Yes, I definitely want to do that. Maybe some afternoons just wandering around the city.
Absolutely! A leisurely stroll can lead to unexpected discoveries. How about planning a couple of open afternoons in your itinerary?
I like that idea.
Great! Now, let’s switch gears a bit. Last session, we talked about using "I" statements to express yourself. Have you had a chance to practice that?
Yes, I tried it with my bridge partner. I told her, "I feel frustrated when we don’t agree on strategy."
How did that go?
Surprisingly well! She listened and we found a compromise.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re making strides in communicating your feelings effectively.
Yes, I feel more confident about it now.
That’s wonderful to hear! Have you had any other opportunities to use "I" statements since then?
I used it with my kids when they were arguing. I told them how their fighting made me feel.
That’s a great application of the technique! How did they respond?
They were surprised at first but then apologized. It felt good to express myself.
It sounds like you’re creating a more open environment for communication. That’s a valuable skill for any relationship.
Yes, I think it’s helping.
Before we wrap up today, is there anything else you’d like to focus on or discuss?
I’d like to talk about managing my anxiety a bit more.
Of course! We can explore some relaxation techniques or mindfulness practices that might help. How does that sound?
That sounds perfect.
One effective technique is deep breathing. Would you like to try a quick exercise together?
Yes, I’d love to!
Great! Let’s take a deep breath in for a count of four... hold for four... and now exhale for a count of six. Ready?
Okay, let’s do it.
That was nice. I feel a bit calmer.
Excellent! You can use this technique anytime you start to feel anxious. Practicing it regularly can help make it a natural response.
I’ll definitely incorporate that into my routine.
Awesome! I’m looking forward to hearing how it goes.
Thank you so much for your help today!
You’re very welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
